docs.lead_paragraph: A reporter with the presence of a performer, Mr. Wallace went head-to-head with chiefs of state, celebrities and con artists for more than 50 years.

headline.seo: Mike Wallace, CBS Pioneer of ‘60 Minutes,’ Dead at 93
headline.main: Mike Wallace, CBS Pioneer of ‘60 Minutes,’ Dies at 93
headline.print_headline: Fierce ‘60 Minutes’ Interrogator Who Didn’t Blink

docs.abstract: Mike Wallace, the CBS reporter who became one of America’s best-known broadcast journalists as an interrogator of the famous and infamous on 60 Minutes, dies at age 93; he went head to head with chiefs of state, celebrities and con artists for more than 50 years, and his success often lay in the questions he hurled, not the answers he received.
docs.snippet: A reporter with the presence of a performer, Mr. Wallace went head-to-head with chiefs of state, celebrities and con artists for more than 50 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Wallace, the CBS reporter who became one of America's best-known broadcast journalists as an interrogator of the famous and infamous on ''60 Minutes,'' died on Saturday. He was 93. On its Web site, CBS said Mr. Wallace died at a care facility in New Canaan, Conn., where he had lived in recent years. Mr. Wallace, who received a pacemaker more than 20 years ago, had a long history of cardiac care and underwent triple bypass heart surgery in January 2008.

Photos (L)

docs.lead_paragraph: A high-profile lawyer who likes soccer and Nirvana.
docs.abstract: Download interview with former United States solicitor general, Paul Clement, who has received widespread praise for his nimble oral arguments before the Supreme Court against the constitutionality of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; Clement offers some recommendations for books, music and television.

docs.lead_paragraph: Financial innovations — from small-business loans to limited liability for investors — have long delivered much good to society. A concept in the new jobs law offers yet another example.

headline.seo: Democratize Wall Street, for Social Good
headline.main: Democratize Wall Street, for Social Good
headline.print_headline: Democratize Wall Street, For Social Good

docs.abstract: Robert J Shiller Economic View column on crowdfunding, which involves Web sites where investors contribute small amounts of capital to designers of projects soliciting funding online; says benefits may not be immediately apparent, but notes that financial innovations have historically delivered much good to society in a variety of ways.
docs.snippet: Financial innovations — from small-business loans to limited liability for investors — have long delivered much good to society. A concept in the new jobs law offers yet another example.

docs.lead_paragraph: The emotions of fear and anger have long motivated consumers and investors. So why can’t everyone become rich?

headline.main: Here Come the Zombies, but Not the Cash
headline.print_headline: Here Come The Zombies, But Not the Cash

docs.abstract: John Schwartz humorous essay on emotions of fear and anger that have long motivated consumers and investors; wonders why more people are unable to harness those emotions to improve their finances and become rich in the stock market.
docs.snippet: The emotions of fear and anger have long motivated consumers and investors. So why can’t everyone become rich?

docs.lead_paragraph: In East New York, where AIDS death rates are high, a health center is taking a holistic approach.

headline.main: A Vision of a Grim Past and a Hopeful Future
headline.print_headline: A Vision of a Grim Past And a Hopeful Future

docs.abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column lauds expansion of the East New York Community Health Center in Brooklyn, where death rates from AIDS are among the highest in the city; notes that center's new wing, made possible by a $541,000 federal grant, functions as a site for primary care and embodies idea that the best prevention against HIV and AIDS is the maintenance of general well-being.
docs.snippet: In East New York, where AIDS death rates are high, a health center is taking a holistic approach.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Oratory Church of St. Boniface, in Brooklyn, is an intentional parish, a destination church that attracts people from beyond its geographic boundaries.

headline.seo: Oratory Church of St. Boniface Draws Congregants From Outside the Parish

docs.abstract: Oratory Church of St Boniface in Downtown Brooklyn espouses an open and inclusive approach to worship and attracts a diverse crowd of followers who travel beyond their own neighborhoods and boroughs to attend; church represents new generation of Catholics who are actively choosing parishes where they feel affirmed, rather than attending their local church.
docs.snippet: The Oratory Church of St. Boniface, in Brooklyn, is an intentional parish, a destination church that attracts people from beyond its geographic boundaries.
